thread.title: David Moyes believes Wayne Rooney would want to return to Everton in the summer
thread.title_full: David Moyes believes Wayne Rooney would want to return to Everton in the summer

author: Luke Edwards
title: David Moyes believes Wayne Rooney would want to return to Everton in the summer
text:
Football David Moyes believes Wayne Rooney would want to return to Everton in the summer Wayne Rooney signed his first professional contract with Everton in 2003 and his manager then, David Moyes, thinks he will head back to Everton Credit: Getty Images Luke Edwards 24 February 2017 • 10:30pm 
D avid Moyes believes Wayne Rooney could return to Everton when he leaves Manchester United in the summer rather than head abroad, even though he will be offered more money to sign for a club in the Chinese Super League. 
Moyes, who gave Rooney his debut as a 16-year-old when he was Everton manager, returns to his former club with Sunderland this weekend and suspects the England captain will also head back to Goodison if he departs Old Trafford. 
Rooney will have no shortage of offers if he does quit United at the end of the season, with clubs in China and the USA likely to be leading the way. 
However, Everton are also expected to sound him out about a potential move and Moyes believes that is where Rooney will want to go. 
“My feeling is there is only one other club Wayne would play for in the Premier League, and that’s Everton,” said Moyes, whose Sunderland team remain bottom of the table ahead of this weekend’s game. David Moyes thinks Wayne Rooney's first choice would be a return to Everton in 2017-18 Credit: PA Wire 
“He’s been a brilliant Manchester United player and given everything for them. But he’s an Everton supporter and I think they are now in a position where they could take it on [a deal for Rooney]. Wayne is still incredibly close to the club.” 
M oyes knows that Rooney will be struggling to come to terms with his impending departure from United, but feels he has made the right decision to wait until the end of the season to assess his options rather than sign for a Chinese club next week. 
“Every player comes to the end of their time,” Moyes added. “And at Man United, it is part of the job as manager to get rid of good players, to keep the club at where it wants to be, those big decisions must be made. 
“Wayne has been in the spotlight since he was 16 - he’s had a lot of coverage and been followed everywhere, some of it good, some of it bad. Whatever he decides will be for the best of him and his family. 
“He’s 31 and has had a brilliant career, but I think he could play on and on, if he wants to. His body is robust enough to take it.” Follow Telegraph Football
